intro: Otoglossum chiriquense, commonly known as the Chiriquí orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically produces a single spike with several showy blooms, each featuring intricate patterns and a distinctive lip. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
